question_sentence: Protests broke out in which Eastern European country following a contested election result?
evidence: The incumbent Georgian Dream party won an unprecedented fourth term after receiving 54% of the vote. Exit polls had put them at around 40%, leading the pro-Western opposition coalition to contest the vote and call for street protests, alleging Russian interference.

question_sentence: A snap election in Japan ended with which incumbent party losing their majority in the House of Representatives?
evidence: The LDP coalition won about 215 seats in the 465-seat House of Representatives, short of the 233 needed for a majority. The LDP remains the largest single party, but the result is a blow to new Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba and his attempt to repair the damage caused by the previous LDP administration's financial scandals.

question_sentence: The Washington Post has lost how many digital subscribers since it declined to endorse a US presidential candidate?
evidence: The Washington Post has lost roughly 10% of its digital subscribers as readers protest the publication's decision to forgo tradition and not make a presidential endorsement. Jeff Bezos, the company's owner, has defended the decision as an effort to restore balance and non-partisanship.

question_sentence: Afghanistan's minister of vice and virtue has announced a restriction that would ban women from doing what?
evidence: Afghanistan's minister of vice and virtue announced a controversial ban, prohibiting women from praying within hearing distance of one another. This new restriction joins existing laws limiting women's voices in public and at home.

question_sentence: The Catholic Church's year-long synod ended in a stalemate on what issue?
evidence: The final document of Pope Francis's year-long synod included a resolution to give women a greater voice within the church. Delegates ruled out ordaining women as priests, but ultimately did not make a ruling on the question of women as deacons.

question_sentence: Hundreds of votes were destroyed in which US city after a ballot box was set on fire?
evidence: Police are investigating a series of ballot box fires in the Pacific Northwest after incendiary devices targeted Portland, Oregon and Vancouver, Washington. Fire suppression systems inside the boxes successfully protected the votes cast in Portland, but unfortunately failed in Vancouver. Replacement votes have been mailed out.

question_sentence: England's bus fare cap will rise to how much, as per Labour's recent Budget?
evidence: Keir Starmer faced criticism after confirming the bus fare cap will rise from £2 to £3 in 2025. The £2 cap was a temporary measure to encourage the use of public transport post-pandemic and a rise had been expected in this week's Budget, but bus operators had lobbied for a maximum cap of £2.50.

question_sentence: A Russian court fined Google what eye-watering sum for blocking pro-Kremlin propaganda?
evidence: The original fine imposed by an earlier ruling was 100,000 rubles (£800), but the court's decision that it should double every week means it now represents a sum well over the $100 trillion world annual GDP.

question_sentence: Scammers conned a London cheesemonger out of 22 tonnes of what?
evidence: One man has been arrested over the theft of £300,000-worth of cheddar cheese from Neal's Yard Dairy in London. Scammers posed as representatives of a major French retailer to fraudulently obtain more than 950 wheels from the artisan cheesemonger.

question_sentence: Which country is experiencing its worst flooding since 1996?
evidence: Torrential rain caused flooding across eastern and southern Spain, resulting in at least 150 deaths. Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez declared three days of national mourning and promised to rebuild affected towns.

question_sentence: What is the significance of the new Dave’s Hot Chicken location opening in Dover
choices: It will be the first Dave’s Hot Chicken restaurant in Delaware
It is located in a historic building over 100 years old
It will be the largest Dave’s Hot Chicken in the country

question_sentence: What is the purpose of the circular video portal installed in Philadelphia's LOVE Park?
choices: To connect Philadelphia with cities in Ireland, Lithuania, and Poland in real time
To provide virtual tours of historical sites

question_sentence: What is the primary event of Delaware's Tag-A-Palooza?
choices: A charity auction for low-digit license plates
A lottery for low-digit license plates
A car show featuring classic vehicles

question_sentence: How long did Sam Cronk train and stable horses at Delaware Park?
What event caused Dahmiere Moody to become the eldest sibling among his siblings?
choices: The birth of a new sibling

question_sentence: What unique feature is part of the couple's Halloween decorations in Laurel, Delaware?
What significant event is happening at Furniture Barn in Delaware?
What milestone did Salesianum boys soccer coach Scott Mosier achieve with his team's victory over Archmere?
choices: He was named coach of the year.
He secured his 10th state championship title.

question_sentence: When did early voting begin in Delaware for the 2024 elections?
What is a Jimmy John's Picklewich?
choices: A sandwich served in a gluten-free wrap
A salad bowl with pickled vegetables
A dessert made with pickles and cream cheese

question_sentence: The most popular Halloween costume of 2024 was inspired by which movie?
evidence: Bob, a shrunken-headed ghost from the recent “Beetlejuice” sequel, is the most searched costume idea in the US this year, according to Google’s annual “Frightgeist” list.

question_sentence: A global shortage of which candy ingredient has led to soaring chocolate prices?
evidence: Cocoa prices have more than doubled since the start of the year and have remained at record highs. As a result, consumers saw smaller chocolate bars in different flavors and more non-chocolate treats on grocery aisle shelves this Halloween.

question_sentence: The 1984 hit movie ”A Nightmare on Elm Street” introduced the world to which frightening character?
evidence: Freddy Krueger, a cult slasher best known for his metal-clawed glove, is the main antagonist in “A Nightmare on Elm Street.” The unmistakable home that served as the focal point of the film is located in Los Angeles.

question_sentence: What do you call a group of witches?
evidence: A group of witches is called a coven – like the witches in the beloved Halloween movie “Hocus Pocus.” A third “Hocus Pocus” film is in development, Walt Disney Studios confirmed, though no information as to the cast or a release date has been made public.

question_sentence: Which acronym describes one of the most popular Starbucks drinks during the fall season?
evidence: The Pumpkin Spice Latte, or PSL as fans call it, gives Starbucks a much-needed sales boost during this time of year. Roughly 10% of the company’s overall sales come from seasonal staples, the coffee chain said.

question_sentence: Which animal is often considered a “bad omen” in Western cultures?
evidence: Black cats are a symbol of Halloween and are frequently associated with bad luck. However, many other traditions hold that black cats are good omens — they were worshiped as gods in ancient Egypt and associated with luck, prosperity and good fortune in France, Japan and England.

question_sentence: Before pumpkins, which items were used to carve jack-o’-lanterns?
evidence: People in Ireland and Scotland originally used turnips as lanterns on Halloween.

question_sentence: Which horror film was the first to win the Academy Award for Best Picture?
evidence: In 1992, “The Silence of the Lambs” became the first horror film to win the Oscar for Best Picture. Stars Anthony Hopkins and Jodie Foster also won Oscars for Best Actor and Best Actress.

question_sentence: “Lycanthrope” is another word for which mythical monster?
evidence: Lycanthrope is a fancy word for werewolf. It’s derived from the Greek words for “wolf” and “human.”

question_sentence: Which Halloween candy dates back to the 1880s?
evidence: Candy corn was first supposedly invented in the late 1800s by a candymaker in Philadelphia. It was designed to look like chicken feed, since at the time candy corn first emerged, about half of Americans worked on farms.
